job_description: software engineering job for the role 2026 Intern – IBM Product Marketing

job_title: Intern - Product Yield Analysis and Analytics (Research)

job_description:
• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Electrical, Mechanical, Chemical, or related field) or equivalent experience.
• 3+ years of process engineering experience, specifically in photolithography.
• Experience with robotic process automation (RPA), and Python.
• Hands-on experience with TEL and ASML equipment a plus.
• 3+ years of experience in semiconductor manufacturing.
• Experience with SPC and data analysis tools.
• Less than 2 years Senior/Principal Engineer, Process Integration, NTI NANDSingapore, SingaporePosted a month ago Advanced Modeling Principal EngineerBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 3 months ago Senior/Engineer, Metrology Process DevelopmentSingapore, SingaporePosted 2 months ago.

• Complete required safety training and conduct all work in accordance with safety policies.
• Encouraged completion of degree between December 2026 and June 2027 Intermediate PC skills Less than 2 years intern-Technician, EquipmentBoise, Idaho, United States of America + 2 morePosted a month ago Must be willing to relocate to Boise if offered a full time role after internship.
• Mechanical proficiency with the ability to understand and troubleshoot mechanical systems Improve reliability by investigating chronic problems and finding solutions.
• Technical Specialist - Facilities ElectricalSingapore, SingaporePosted a month ago Relocating to Boise, Idaho to complete a 3-month internship.

• Experience with firmware development for embedded systems, including knowledge of microcontrollers and real-time operating systems.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
• Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively convey complex technical information to diverse audiences.
• Experience with industry-standard SerDes protocols (e.
• Support the development of embedded firmware, implementing features and functionalities as needed.
• AMD Partner Hub Authorized Distributors AMD University Program Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in related discipline preferred Investor Relations Financial Information Board of Directors Governance Documents SEC Filings.
• Proficiency in Python for test development and automation.
• Solid understanding of high-speed digital design and signal integrity principles.

• The ideal candidate will have experience in Microchip firmware (MPLAB, Harmony), embedded Linux (ARM SoCs, Quartus), C++ GUI development with Qt, and networking (TCP/UDP).
• You'll translate customer needs into technical solutions and support project development end-to-end.
• Security clearance eligibility required (DoD preferred).
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
